intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium poliobrachinodes, commonly known as the branched-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat head. It is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
